item.title: Git - Stop Tracking Files While Keeping Them Locally
item.description: Goal Stop Git from tracking a file or folder that’s already committed, while keeping it in your working directory. Context .gitignore only prevents untracked files from being added. Files already tracked by Git will continue to be tracked even after adding them to .gitignore. Solution Remove the file from Git’s index while keeping it locally: git rm --cached <file> For folders: git rm -r --cached <folder> The file removal is staged immediately but only takes effect in the repository after you commit:
